articles.title: Congratulations to Nepalese PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Nepalese PM
 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Pushpa Kamal Dahal on Thursday on his election as prime minister of the Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal.
					 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing him success in his responsible work for the country's political stability and economic development.

articles.title: Three-Revolution Exhibition House Marks 70th Founding Anniversary
articles.content:
Three-Revolution Exhibition House Marks 70th Founding Anniversary
 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The Three-Revolution Exhibition House of the DPRK marked the 70th founding anniversary.
					 The exhibition house has successfully fulfilled its mission along the glorious path of development under the meticulous guidance and care of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for 70 years.
					
					 The officials and employees have plaster statues of the President, photos and teachings of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu displayed with due respect at different halls. They successfully arranged the Exhibition of Works on the Juche Idea and have put its operation on a regular footing, thus contributing to explaining the ideological and theoretical feats of the great leaders to the visitors.
					
					 They have displayed all machines and equipment, products and successes made by the Korean people at every stage of socialist construction and explained them to the visitors, helping them know well about the development of the DPRK.
					
					 They briskly displayed, disseminated and exchanged the latest and practical sci-tech achievements and intellectual products, thereby playing the role of a centre for disseminating sci-tech knowledge through domestic and international exhibitions.
					
					 There was a meeting to mark the founding anniversary on Friday.
					
					 Present at the meeting were Choe Thae Bok, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), officials and employees of the exhibition house.
					
					 A congratulatory message of the WPK Central Committee was conveyed to the employees and officials of the exhibition house.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Tours Pyongyang
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Tours Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Japan-Korea Friendship Linking with Juche headed by Takashi Koiwai, vice-chairman of the Japan Matsumoto Citizens Council for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, visited the Sci-Tech Complex.
					 The guests paid tribute to the picture of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the complex.
					
					 They went round various places of the complex, a great sanctuary of learning for all people.
					
					 They also toured the Rungna Dolphinarium, Mirae Scientists Street, etc. and Mt. Kumgang and enjoyed a performance given by the National Circus at the Pyongyang Circus Theater.

articles.title: DPRK Witnesses Unusual Summer Weather
articles.content:
DPRK Witnesses Unusual Summer Weather 
 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Unusual weather has been observed in the DPRK affected by abnormal summer atmospheric circulation.
					 In this regard, Choe Kwang Guk, head of the National Meteorological Forecast Squad, told KCNA:
					
					 This year's atmospheric circulation in Northeast Asia is different from the years before.
					
					 High pressure formed in Tibet area hits the northern area of the country, instead of high pressure over northeast Pacific.
					
					 The rainy spell began on July 22, later than the average year.
					
					 The influence of rainy season became weak from July 28, with hot weather lingering.
					
					 And sporadic showers were observed in different parts of the country.
					
					 The abnormal weather conditions will last until early August and the temperature is expected to rise higher than the end of July.
					
					 Rainfall will be seen in mid-August, with heavy rain in different parts of the country.
					
					 Rainy season will come to a close at the end of August.
					
					 Meanwhile, several rounds of typhoon are expected to hit the country this month.

articles.title: Silk Production Goes Up in DPRK
articles.content:
Silk Production Goes Up in DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Significant achievements have been made in the DPRK's sericulture.
					 A progress was made in the work to breed high-yield silkworms suitable to the country's climatic and soil conditions and cultivate good species of mulberry.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill and other silk mills across the country have raised the daily production of quality silk thread twice the schedule through a mass technological innovation movement.
					
					 The Pakchon Silk Mill made big strides in the efforts to improve the technology of processing silk fabrics.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Demands Withdrawal of U.S. Imperialist Aggression Forces from S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Demands Withdrawal of U.S. Imperialist Aggression Forces from S. Korea
 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Friday says in an article that the withdrawal of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces from south Korea is the basic way of holding in check the U.S. frantic moves for increasing nuclear war hardware there and defusing the danger of a nuclear war against the DPRK.
					 The article notes that the U.S. imperialist aggression forces in south Korea are the cancer-like entity, the  source harassing peace on the Korean peninsula and increasing the danger of a nuclear war while performing the U.S. policy for aggression against the DPRK on the spot.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. has turned south Korea into a huge outpost for a nuclear war against the DPRK, putting spurs to the nuclear weaponization of its forces in south Korea from long ago. 
					
					 The above-said aggressor forces are working hard to bring a nuclear war disaster to the land of Korea while throwing a stumbling block in the way of peace on the Korean peninsula and national reunification. The Koreans can never live in peace unless the aggressor forces are withdrawn from south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggression forces in south Korea are, indeed like a time bomb planted in the arsenal for a nuclear war and it is the most urgent matter to force them to withdraw from there.
					
					 The Koreans can never allow their land to be reduced to a theatre of a nuclear war for the U.S. as they suffered a war disaster in the 1950s due to the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 All compatriots in the north, the south and abroad should put a definite end to the moves of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces and their war servants south Korean warmongers in ignite a new war on the peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Forces to Stage Saber-rattling
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Forces to Stage Saber-rattling
 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The 27th division of the south Korean puppet ground force announced that it would stage a field mobile drill under the simulated conditions of coping with a "local war" and all-out war provoked by someone in the areas of Chunchon and Hwachon, Kangwon Province of south Korea, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 Not only huge troops and war hardware under the division but also civilians, administrative officials and police will reportedly be involved in the 8-day drill.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Education Ministry's Propagation about THAAD Rejected
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Education Ministry's Propagation about THAAD Rejected 
 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Education offices across south Korea refused to execute the official document distributed by the Ministry of Education on THAAD deployment, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 On July 24 the ministry in its official document instructed the city and provincial education offices to help the teaching staff, students and their parents properly understand the "guide to all people" related to the THAAD deployment made and distributed by the Ministry of Defense.
					
					 An official of the Seoul City Education Office on July 28 clarified his stand not to execute the official document, saying propaganda about THAAD is not just.
					
					 Earlier, the education offices in Kyonggi and North Jolla Provinces decided not to send the official document to schools. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the south Korean Kangwon Provincial Education Office held that it wrongly sent the official document to primary, secondary and high schools by mistaking it for a manual for students' life.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers' Frantic Arms Build-up under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers' Frantic Arms Build-up under Fire
 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- South Korean warmongers are hell-bent on arms build-up as part of the moves to invade the north.
					 The south Korean puppet Navy took over four Europe-made helicopters for naval operation with due ceremony on July 27.
					
					 They are going to deploy the helicopters for action up till next year through the training of pilots, live bullet firing drill, etc. and to additionally introduce four helicopters till the end of this year. 
					
					 Next day, a new type high-speed boat was launched to perform an operational duty in the biggest hotspot waters in the West Sea of Korea. They are mulling building such boats in real earnest from 2019 for deployment.
					
					 Meanwhile, the puppet ground force is contemplating equipping frontline units with more than 100 latest tanks and developing ammunitions transport drones within this year for deployment.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Slams "Agreement" on Issue of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Slams "Agreement" on Issue of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore on July 28 carried an article accusing the U.S., Japan and the south Korean authorities of covering up the truth of history and rapidly pushing forward the formation of the triangular alliance by dint of the "agreement" on the issue of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					 The article recalled that Obama in a phone message to Park Geun Hye on Jan. 7 this year congratulated her on having reached an "agreement" on the issue of the sexual slavery, highly appreciated her courageous action and the "agreement" is aimed to bolstering up the capabilities of south Korea, the U.S. and Japan to counter the nuclear test of the north.
					
					 The article said that as many experts repeatedly commented, the "agreement" was not the one for settling conflict in the past  history but the strategic one for tightening the military alliance among the U.S., Japan and south Korea.

articles.title: Absurdity of THAAD Deployment in S. Korea Disclosed by Xinhua
articles.content:
Absurdity of THAAD Deployment in S. Korea Disclosed by Xinhua
 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The Xinhua News Agency on July 30 referred to the absurdity of the U.S.-south Korea decision on the deployment of THAAD.
					 The south Korean regime should restrain itself from the dangerous saber-rattling such as THAAD deployment which wrecks the regional stability, Xinhua said.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean regime alleged that the Terminal High Altitude Area Defense System (THAAD) to be deployed in south Korea doesn't target the third country but aims at coping with the "nuclear and missile threat" from the DPRK, Xinhua noted, and continued:
					
					 It is as clear as a pikestaff that the THAAD deployment will constitute a crucial phase in implementing the U.S. pivot to Asia strategy and escalate the tension in Northeast Asia, on the Korean peninsula, in particular.
					
					 It also betrays short-sighted and clumsy diplomatic judgment of the south Korean regime which blindly follows the U.S. though the former is well aware of the consequences of the THAAD deployment.
					
					 THAAD is good for nothing in the face of the DPRK's short-range missiles and artillery pieces.
					
					 It will only prompt the DPRK to take an offensive stand. The DPRK has already warned that it would take strong physical countermeasures.
					
					 Escalation of tension on the peninsula will be the bitterest legacy of the Park Geun Hye regime and the greatest misfortune to the Koreans as it will dash their hope for peace and national reunification.
					
					 The south Korean regime had better think twice whether it can be profited from the THAAD deployment and go through the dangerous measure again.

articles.title: China News Service Denounces THAAD Deployment in S. Korea
articles.content:
China News Service Denounces THAAD Deployment in S. Korea
Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The China News Service posted an article opposing THAAD deployment in south Korea on July 31.
					The article said:
					
					The U.S. and the south Korean authorities recently decided to deploy THAAD in a U.S. military base in south Korea.
					
					The U.S. and the south Korean authorities assert that the THAAD deployment is "not targeting the third country but is aimed to cope with the nuclear threat from north Korea." However, this will explicitly destroy the regional strategic balance only to face strong opposition from surrounding countries.
					
					Illusion about THAAD that it would guarantee security will finally bring crisis to Northeast Asia and rouse doubt, vigilance and hostility of the regional countries, and the U.S. will only be forced to drink a bitter cup.
					
					The decision on THAAD deployment which is regarded by the DPRK as a military provocation will lead to a series of strong counteraction and thus further threaten peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and in the region.
					
					If China and Russia take countermeasures, thinking THAAD would destroy the regional strategic balance, it will have serious impact on peace and stability on the Korean peninsula.
					
					A spokesperson for the Defense Ministry of China clarified that China will closely watch the maneuvers of the U.S. and south Korea and that it will take into account necessary steps to protect strategic security of the country and maintain the strategic balance in the region.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Introduced by Austrian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Introduced by Austrian Organization 
 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK posted "8. The Triumphant Return" from "Chapter 24 Nationwide Resistance against the Japanese" of Vol. 8 (Continuing Edition) of Part 1 the Anti-Japanese Revolution of President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences "With the Century" on its website on August 1.
					 Posted there was a portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Exposicion Permanente de Tres Revoluciones acoge 70o aniversario de su fundacion
articles.content:
Exposicion Permanente de Tres Revoluciones acoge 70o aniversario de su fundacion
Pyongyang, 5 de agosto (ACNC) -- Cumplio 70 anos la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones.
					Durante 7 decenios despues de su fundacion, la exposicion cumplio bien su deber recorriendo una senda de desarrollo orgulloso bajo la direccion minuciosa del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Los funcionarios y empleados de ella colocaron en los pabellones por sectores las estatuas de yeso del Presidente, las fotos de los grandes hombres sin iguales del monte Paektu y sus instrucciones y contribuyeron a la explicacion y divulgacion de las hazanas ideo-teoricas de los grandes Lideres al asegurar la operacion normal del pabellon de las obras de la idea Juche, acondicionado excelentemente.
					
					Exhibieron todos los equipos mecanicos y articulos, hechos por cuenta propia por el pueblo coreano en cada etapa de la construccion socialista, e hicieron propaganda del aspecto de desarrollo de la RPDC al profundizar las labores de explicacion y divulgacion.
					
					Activaron la exhibicion, divulgacion e intercambio sobre los exitos cientifico-tecnicos de punta y de usos practicos y aseguraron las exhibiciones nacionales e internacionales cumpliendo asi el papel de la base de divulgacion de conocimientos cientifico-tecnicos.
					
					En el acto por el 70o aniversario que tuvo lugar el dia 5, participaron el vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, y los funcionarios y empleados de la entidad.
					
					Se dio lectura al mensaje de felicitacion del CC del PTC enviado a los empleados y funcionarios de la exposicion.
